page.title: 11PHYSICAL GROWTH OF P.GLASGOW
page.content: Port Glasgow grew up on the banks of the{River}Clyde. The shape of the land here was relatively flat. In physical terms this is known as the raised beach. Behind the{raised beach,}the land rises steeply. This tended to inhibit the physical expansion of the town in a nucleated pattern. Instead the town tended to develop in a linear fashion along the banks of the River Clyde. But, as the town grew{sites}for expansion were at a premium. For this purpose the high plateau above the raised beach started to be developed, firstly for housing and then for industry. And today, it is this area which is still being expanded. Physical and human have interacted to give the present{landscape.
